com.google.publicalerts.cap

Class CapXmlParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.publicalerts.cap.CapXmlParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCapProfile

    public class CapXmlParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses CAP XML, optionally validating. Supports CAP 1.0, 1.1, and 1.2, but all alerts in the same document must have the same schema. Ignores enveloped digital signature. To validate the signature, use XmlSignatureValidator.

    TODO(shakusa) Explicit XEE prevention here like Rome's WireFeedInput?

    TODO(shakusa) Support input from javax.xml.transform.Source ?

    • Constructor Detail

      • CapXmlParser

        public CapXmlParser(boolean validate)
        Creates a new parser.
        Parameters:
        validate - if true, the parseFrom methods throw a CapException if given invalid CAP XML. If false, no CapException will be thrown, though a SAXParseException or NotCapException could still be thrown if the XML is not valid or not CAP. Instead, if there are errors parsing a field, it is left as null.

      • CapXmlParser

        public CapXmlParser(boolean validate,
            boolean strictXsdValidation)
        Creates a new parser.
        Parameters:
        validate - if true, the parseFrom methods throw a CapException if given invalid CAP XML. If false, no CapException will be thrown, though a SAXParseException or NotCapException could still be thrown if the XML is not valid or not CAP. Instead, if there are errors parsing a field, it is left as null.
        strictXsdValidation - if true, perform by-the-spec xsd schema validation, which does not check a number of properties specified elsewhere in the spec. If false (the default), attempt to do extra validation to conform to the text of the spec.

    • Method Detail

      • toCircle

        public static Circle toCircle(java.lang.String str)
        Parses a CAP circle area from a string.
        Parameters:
        str - A string encoding a circle, as described in the CAP schema. It should be a coordinate pair, followed by a radius.
        Returns:
        A CAP Circle with the same center and radius, or null if the string failed to parse.

      • toPolygon

        public static Polygon toPolygon(java.lang.String str)
        Parses a CAP circle area from a string.
        Parameters:
        str - A string encoding a polygon, as described in the CAP schema. It should be a space-separated list of points, each of which is a comma-separated list of doubles.
        Returns:
        A CAP Polygon with the same points, or null if the string failed to parse.

      • toPolygonNullIfTooFew

        public static Polygon toPolygonNullIfTooFew(java.lang.String str)
        Parses a CAP Polygon, returning null if it has fewer than 4 points. Like CapXmlParser.toPolygon, but additionally returns null if the polygon has too few (less than four) points.
        Parameters:
        str - A string encoding a polygon, as described in the CAP schema. It should be a space-separated list of points, each of which is a comma-separated list of doubles.
        Returns:
        A CAP Polygon with the same points, or null if the string failed to parse, or contains fewer than 4 points.

      • parseFrom

        public final Alert parseFrom(java.lang.String str)
                      throws CapException,
                             NotCapException,
                             org.xml.sax.SAXParseException
        Parse the given alert.
        Parameters:
        str - the CAP XML to parse, as a UTF-8 string
        Returns:
        the parsed alert
        Throws:
        CapException - if validate is true and there are parse-related or validation errors
        NotCapException - if the XML is not CAP XML
        org.xml.sax.SAXParseException - on XML parsing error

      • parseFrom

        public final Alert parseFrom(java.lang.String str,
              Reasons.Builder reasons)
                      throws NotCapException,
                             org.xml.sax.SAXParseException
        Parse the given alert.
        Parameters:
        str - the CAP XML to parse, as a UTF-8 string
        reasons - a collection to which to add any non-fatal errors, warnings or recommendations during parsing
        Returns:
        the parsed alert
        Throws:
        NotCapException - if the XML is not CAP XML
        org.xml.sax.SAXParseException - on XML parsing error
